title: Global Initiative for Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) Criteria for COPD
desc: The Global Initiative for Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) Criteria for COPD assesses different stages of COPD and provides treatment recommendations.

data.evidence:
GOLD 1–4 refers to the grade of airflow obstruction, and GOLD A-D are the groups on which treatment recommendations are based.

From the Global Strategy for the Diagnosis, Management and Prevention of COPD, Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) 2017.
data.facts:
Interpretation:

GOLD group

Risk

3-year mortality*

Pharmacologic treatment recommendation

A

Low risk, low symptom burden

3.8%

Bronchodilator (long- or short-acting)

B

Low risk, higher symptom burden

10.6%

Long-acting bronchodilator (LABA) or long-acting methacholine antagonist (LAMA)

C

High risk, low symptom burden

8.2%

LAMA (or LAMA + LABA, or LABA + ICS (inhaled corticosteroids) if frequent exacerbations)

D

High risk, higher symptom burden

20.1%

LAMA and LABA, plus inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) if frequent exacerbations

*From Lange 2012, based on GOLD 2011 criteria.
